Package com.taco.suit_lady.view._nonimported

Class FXApplication

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.taco.suit_lady.view._nonimported.FXApplication
public class FXApplication extends javafx.application.Application

The JFX Application instance implemented and executed by the Parent Application.


Details

  • Handles the UI Logic using the JavaFX Library.
  • The JFX Application instance is typically the primary entry point for the application, but not when integrated with Spring:
    • Instead, the FxWeaver library integrates JavaFX into the Spring Framework.
    • Once integrated and initialized by FxWeaver, Spring manages the JFX Application.
    • The MainApplication instead serves as an initializer and container for JavaFX, Spring, and any additional application-level functions.
      • It is ideal to use Spring to handle as much of the application-level variables and functionality as possible.
      • TODO: A Database Module to handle Persistent Data retrieval, storage, and general management must also be integrated.

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()

      Constructs, initializes, and runs the ApplicationContext for this JavaFX Application.


      Initialization Sequence

      1. Constructs a ClassPathXmlApplicationContext:
        1. Defines array defining the XML Configuration Files.
        2. Defines the Parent Context of the XML Context as the Root Context, defined above.
        3. The XML Context then Refreshes the Application Contexts.
      2. Constructs the Root Context:
        1. Constructs a new SpringApplicationBuilder instance.
        2. Adds MainApplication.class to the SpringApplicationBuilder as a source.
        3. Constructs and Runs the Root Context using the SpringApplicationBuilder.
      3. Registers Shutdown Hooks for all ApplicationContexts.
        • Shutdown Hooks instruct Spring to close each Context automatically when the MainApplication is terminated.
        • i.e., Shutdown Hooks remove the need to close each Context manually.
      Overrides:
      init in class javafx.application.Application

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)

      Initialization sequence bridging the fully initialized JFX Stage and any Non-UI Functions.


      Details

      • This method is called directly after the JavaFX application Stage and all corresponding JavaFX UI functionality has finished its initialization .
      • Some Non-UI Functions are handled internally via Spring.
      • Executed on the JavaFX UI Application Thread.

      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The fully initialized JavaFX Stage instance serving as the View Module of the main Application.

    • stop

      public void stop()

      Executes any operations required for the proper Termination of the MainApplication.


      Details

      • Executed internally by JavaFX when the MainApplication is terminated.
      • In the future, this method can also serve to help prevent any UI Memory Leaks.
        • This will be especially relevant with any future multithreading implementations.

      • Application Context Termination:

        • Shutdown Hooks automatically close the Application Contexts internally.
        • Application Contexts do not need to be closed manually.
        • The Shutdown Hooks are registered when the Contexts are initialized.
      Overrides:
      stop in class javafx.application.Application
